name: Clarion Hotel Dublin Airport

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel because it is very close to the airport. The staff were appalling with the exception of one person, Daniel.
reviews.title: Don't stay at the Clarion

likes.liked: — Making my own bed made me feel at home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other staff at reception were like sulky teenagers: the smallest request proved to be tiresome and an inconvenience including Dennis and the barman. At one point there were 10 residents in the bar and not a barman to be found.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel close to the Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got a smoking room, an ashtray, cigarettes from the bar but matches- not a chance!
reviews.title: Miserable place with staff who couldn't care less about guests

likes.liked: — close to the airport, with a limo to take people back and forth
likes.disliked: — rude staff, over priced, surprise addition to our bill of about $10, long wait in dining room, Internet access only in lobby

reviews.text: The bed wasn't even made properly.
reviews.title: Won't be back

likes.disliked: — Almost everything especially the surly male receptionist

reviews.title: very dissapointed
reviews.text: The hotel was clean but I would not stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Clarion Hotel the first night on our arrival in Ireland.
reviews.title: No recommendation

likes.disliked: — corridor light shined into the room, to loud

reviews.text: Positive: the shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel; the room was well equipped; dinner and breakfast were delicious
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Negative: room door looked to be sawn to short, so the corridor light couldn't let us sleep ; it smelled musty; because the room was towards the street it was very loud; the room was dark because it was located in the lower ground; we ordered a bottle of water that never was brought
reviews.title: An okay hotel

likes.liked: — The staff and that it is placed right in the airport
likes.disliked: — The noice from the parking lot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: disappointing stay. paid additional money for an "executive" room.
reviews.title: lovely quick stay but....

reviews.text: was meant to include free internet...which didn't work. checked into my room, to find uncleared dishes and no chair at the desk. i reported this to front desk, but nothing was done. also, wrote a detailed complaint and have had no response. i choose hotels for a party of 12-16 people. never again.
reviews.title: worst hotel of the 5 we stayed in, in Ireland

likes.liked: — the ease of getting to the airport
likes.disliked: — the lack of cleanliness, the lack of friendliness amongst the staff

reviews.text: A good Airport Hotel in that it is clean, with good facilities, very near Dublin Airport, with an efficient shuttle Bus.
reviews.title: A Late Breakfast

reviews.text: My complaint is that Breakfast does not start untill 7am. which seems inordinately late for a hotel whose guests will often have to be at the airport at a very early hour ( in my case 6-30am)
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.text: True, a carry out brealfast can be supplied on request, but what good is this to someone who might only be eating airline meals for the rest of the day, and who would appreciate a hot breakfast before their long journey.
reviews.title: Avoid
Excellent quality and price
reviews.text: I stayed here in March and found the hotel and its staff excellent! The hotel had a shuttle bus which brought us the short distance from the airport to the hotel. The room was quiet and clean and very comfortable. The food in the restaurant was first class as was the service! I would highly recommend a stay here if you want a hotel near the airport. I have stayed in other airport hotels and none compared in terms of value for money and location to the airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel prior to an early flight. It has a great location, a lovely lobby, and friendly staff. But the rooms are so poor. The room I was in was tiny and looked like it had been totally overlooked during the re-furbishment. The facilities in it were basic, and it seemed delapidated. I have never stayed here before having previously stayed in other airport hotels and I will never stay here again. There is much better choice in the surrounding area than this and it was certainly overpriced for the quality of the room that I got.
reviews.title: Will not be using this hotel again.

reviews.text: I booked this hotel on the basis that it was a 4 star hotel (according to the majority of booking engines out there) and it was very close to Dublin airport. It is very close to the airport and this must be its best feature. There is no way that this hotel is 4 star - I think TripAdvisor has it correct when it classes it as 2 star.
reviews.title: Very close to the airport and handy shuttle bus

reviews.text: The shuttle bus will take you on the 2 minute drive from the airport to the hotel and I didn't have to wait long for the bus at all. I checked in to my double room only to find that I had been assigned two single beds (and they really were single unlike many other hotels where singles are closer to double size).
reviews.title: Handy for an early flight out of Dublin

reviews.text: My room was in the 'old' part of the hotel and it looked as though it had recently had a very cheap refurbishment. The doors, bathroom and everything else had been covered in a layer of white paint to give the feeling of being new. Brush marks from the paintbrushes were very prominent on everything, and it just looked very poor. The carpet looked relatively new but hadn't been fitted very well and there were gaps next to the wall. The bathroom units obviously hadn't been replaced and looked dated - it also had a musty smell to it.
reviews.title: A good airport hotel

reviews.text: There was no iron or safe in the room and the mini-bar was only filled on request to reception. There was, however, a kettle and a trouser press. The rooms weren't far off a Travelodge in terms of luxury or quality.
reviews.title: I will never use this hotel again because of the room quality!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 'new' bit of the hotel contained the bar and reception. This part of the hotel certainly had a modern and slightly 'trendy' feel to it. The bar had lights which changed color and loud dance music from an event going on in one of the rooms meant that it felt more like a nightclub than a place to relax and have a drink.
reviews.title: All Round Good Hotel

description: Dublin Airport's Original Hotel located within Dublin Airport complex. The hotel is located only 3 minutes from the main terminal and is accessible by 24 hour coach pickup from the Airport. All rooms fully air-conditioned. Complimentary WI-FI in hotel lobby, bar, restaurant & all meeting rooms. 248 well appointed Superior and Executive bedrooms. Family & interconnecting rooms available. Kids stay and eat free at this property.Direct Access to Croke Park Stadium and the New O2.
